definition: foreign land/a place far from home
different/other/hetero-/unusual/strange/surprising/to distinguish/to separate/to discriminate
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)
a stranger in a strange land (from a poem by Wang Wei 王維|王维[Wang2 Wei2])
pinyin: du2 zai4 yi4 xiang1 wei2 yi4 ke4

definition: stranger

sentences.english: All the people who flying over other cities will go home to celebrate with their families.
sentences.chinese: 所有流落异乡的人都会回家过节。

sentences.english: The noise of dogs made me a stranger here.
sentences.chinese: 狗吠声让我变成异乡人，让我止步难前。

sentences.english: There are many things that as a stranger initially threw me for a loop.
sentences.chinese: 最初，有很多事让我这个初来乍到的异乡人眩晕。

sentences.english: He is a stranger in New York.
sentences.chinese: 在纽约他是一个异乡人。

sentences.english: Oh to what foreign land do you sail?
sentences.chinese: 哦，你在行驶向异乡的何处？

sentences.english: On hearing it, those Swiss living abroad will feel homesick.
sentences.chinese: 客居异乡的瑞士人听了放牧调会引起强烈的思乡之情。

sentences.english: He had to quit the position and went in exile, having been deprived of his power.
sentences.chinese: 他被褫夺了权力之后，只好离职，漂泊异乡。

sentences.english: Cadmus gave thanks and, stooping down, kissed the foreign soil, then lifting his eyes, greeted the surrounding mountains.
sentences.chinese: 卡德摩斯谢过神明，躬身亲吻这片异乡的土地，然后。

sentences.english: The stranger paused a moment in revery before this tender and calming spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 这个异乡人在那种温柔宁静的景物前出了一会神。

sentences.english: When Americans discover that you are a stranger.
sentences.chinese: 当美国人发现你是一位异乡人的时候。

sentences.english: East of the river, strangers from across the seas were seen less seldom.
sentences.chinese: 而在河东岸，狭海对面的异乡人则少见的多。

sentences.english: And you are not a pining outcast amongst strangers?
sentences.chinese: 你没有憔悴不堪，流落在异乡人中间吗？

sentences.english: The poetry to those who wish to realize their ideal, wandering a strange land.
sentences.chinese: 谨以此文献给那些为实现自己的理想而漂泊异乡的人。

sentences.english: Who dressed you, love, as a foreigner?
sentences.chinese: 是谁把你，我的情人，装扮成一个异乡人？

sentences.english: They roved in foreign lands for more than twenty years and returned to their hometown at long last.
sentences.chinese: 他们流落异乡二十余载，最后终于返回故里。

sentences.english: Chapter four discusses the stranger's pursuit of ideal home.
sentences.chinese: 第四章主要论述异乡人对理想家园的追寻。

definition: foreign land/away from one's native place
foreign lands and places (idiom); living as expatriate
to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
stranger
person living or traveling far from home
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to live abroad/to be traveling/traveler
native country/one's homeland
home/homeland/native place/CL:個|个[ge4]
a stranger in a strange land (from a poem by Wang Wei 王維|王维[Wang2 Wei2])
pinyin: du2 zai4 yi4 xiang1 wei2 yi4 ke4

definition: variant of 漂泊[piao1 bo2]
to be homesick
to wander far from home
to leave one's homeplace (to find work, flee disaster etc)
to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on/without a friend in the world
to leave one's homeland
